titleStmt.title: Speculum Britanniae. The first parte an historicall, & chorographicall discription of Middlesex. Wherin are also alphabeticallie sett downe, the names of the cyties, townes, parishes hamletes, howses of name &c. W.th direction spedelie to finde anie place desired in the mappe & the distance betwene place and place without compasses. Cum priuilegio. By the trauaile and vew of Iohn Norden. Anno 1593
Speculum Britanniae. Part 1
titleStmt.author: Norden, John, 1548-1625?

titleStmt.title: Speculum Britanniae. The first parte an historicall, & chorographicall discription of Middlesex. Wherin are also alphabeticallie sett downe, the names of the cyties, townes, parishes hamletes, howses of name &c. W.th direction spedelie to finde anie place desired in the mappe & the distance betwene place and place without compasses. Cum priuilegio. By the trauaile and vew of Iohn Norden. Anno 1593
Speculum Britanniae. Part 1
titleStmt.author: Norden, John, 1548-1625?
Keere, Pieter van den, ca. 1571-ca. 1624, engraver.

biblFull.extent: [8], 48, [4] p., [3] folded plates : maps, coats of arms (woodcuts)

notesStmt.note: The title page is engraved and signed "Pieter Vanden Keere scalp: [sic] 1593." Variant 1: title page unsigned.
With Elizabeth I's arms on [A]2v. Variant 2: this page blank.
With an Anglo-Saxon alphabet on [A]4v. Variant 3: quire [A] in another, probably earlier setting, lacking the alphabet.
Running title reads: Middlesex I. pars Speculi Britanni√¶.
With a final leaf of verses and errata.
Reproductions of the originals in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Both CSmH 62784 and CSmH 62786 are filmed.
